title: 2 Easy Ways to Find the Seed of a Minecraft Realm or Server

steps.title: Use the command /seed to find the seed.
steps.content: Use the command /seed to find the seed. This command will only work if you are in a solo game , the admin of a server , or have permission to do commands. Just type it into the chat and press Enter . This will display the numeric seed in the chatlog. Minecraft Java Edition is available on Windows, Mac, and Linux.

steps.title: Launch Minecraft and select Play.
steps.content: Launch Minecraft and select Play . You should see a list of your Realms. You must be the admin of the realm to get the seed . [1] X Research source Minecraft Bedrock Edition is available on Windows 10 and 11, Xbox One, Xbox Series S and X, PlayStation 4 and 5 , Nintendo Switch, Fire OS/TV, Android, and iOS.

steps.title: Select the pencil icon next to the Realm.
steps.content: Select the pencil icon next to the Realm. This will open the Game Settings . If you aren't already on this tab, select it from the left panel.

steps.title: Scroll down and select Download World.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Download World . It will take a few moments for the world to download.

steps.title: Return to the list of active Realms.
steps.content: Return to the list of active Realms. You'll find the Realm copy underneath Worlds .

steps.title: Select the pencil next to the Realm copy.
steps.content: Select the pencil next to the Realm copy. This will open the Game Settings .

steps.title: Scroll down to find the seed.
steps.content: Scroll down to find the seed. This will be underneath World Type .
